summary: The federal Long-Term Care Ombudsman Program aims to protect the health and welfare of residents in long-term care facilities. Through federal funding, each state has a program that provides various services to long-term care residents, including resolving complaints and advocating for systemic improvements. State programs were responsible for serving over 3 million residents across 76,000 facilities in FY 2022. In this Q&A, we interviewed state...
title: Long-Term Care: Information on the Ombudsman Program
